newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil tumbles at close on technical sell-off.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil tumbles at close on technical sell-off.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL
Sept (3rd pos) 1,161 rgt/tonne June (south) 1,217.50
Open/Hi/Low 1,180/1,182/1,160 Prev close 1,220
Prev settlement 1,179 * sellers prices
PALM OIL FUTURES - Active technical selling appeared towards
the close after Sept futures broke the 1,170 and 1,168 levels.
PORLA's slightly friendly end-May stocks and SGS's June 1-15
exports failed to stir buying. Market was uncertain and
September next support would be at 1,150 level.
PALM OIL PHYSICALS - lack of buyers and weaker futures
dragged down cash prices in nearby CPOs.
Other contracts also posted double-digit losses.
"There was little reaction to the friendly PORLA end-May stock data and prices were hardly moved in early afternoon trade," a trader said.
The Palm Oil Registration and Licensing and Authority (PORLA) released the May crop data after the closure of the morning market.
PORLA put end-May stocks at 711,841 tonnes, compared with private crop forecaster Ivan Wong's estimate of 740,000 tonnes.
Palm oil output in May was up 7.61 percent to 790,640 tonnes and exports were 626,606 tonnes.

Traders said the June 1-15 palm oil exports by cargo surveyor had no impact as the data was within market expectations. SGS said June 1-15 palm oil exports were at 290,935 tonnes against 264,659 tonnes for May 1-15.

Prices opened slightly higher in line with a steady soyoil futures in Chicago last week with news of Malaysian Oil Palm Growers' Council (MPOGC) production estimate of 782,000 tonnes having little impact on the market.
"Market was uncertain and the near-term prospect looks bearish as September is heading downward, a technical analyst said. "The next support for September is 1,150." he said.
Physicals June (south) crude palm oil saw offers at 1,217.50 ringgit against bids at 1,212.50 after trading at 1,217.50, 1,220 and 1,212.50. June (central) saw offers at 1,200 versus 1,190.
July (south) saw offers at 1,217.50 after bids of 1,212.50 with earlier trades of 1,215 and 1,212.50 and July (central) saw offers at 1,200 against bids 1,190.
In refined products, July RBD palm oil was offered at $510 and Aug/Sept at $510.
July RBD palm olein saw offers at $550 and Aug/Sept at $547.50. July was traded at $551 and $547.50.
July RBD palm stearin was offered at $382.50, Aug/Sept at $380 and July/Aug palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $275.
